website_summaries.verdict: A challenging, well-made kit for those who are willing to work for spectacular results.
pros: This 150-piece model kit is based off one of the most legendary vehicles to grace the tuning and racing scenes
The plastic pieces are durable and well-designed, and the assembly time of 5 hours is involved enough to satisfy modelers with intermediate experience
cons: This model comes bare, so additional supplies will be needed to complete it

customer_reviews.title: Awsome kit.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic kit, parts are high grade as always. Decals are spot on and the finish came out great after some real elbo grease. Iv been wanting to build the 2f2f skyline for awhile and finally broke down and did it.
customer_reviews.author: austin127

customer_reviews.title: Very fun!
customer_reviews.text: Second model and loved it even though it was easier to build then my first one (Toyota Supra). Testors paint and Tamiya glue are my choice. Along with Transon paint brushes and small wire cutters. You will also want tweesors. It only taken me about 2 hours to build this thing but it was really fun! Love how they give you screen for the grille!
customer_reviews.author: Daneyon B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a gift!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves all things cars! The box was a little bent but other than that, nothing was broken and it looks like all the pieces are there. The only think that I would say is it would be nice if the glue/cement was included with the model car. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome model
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for sons birthday by accident. Didn’t read and thought it was a die cast car. Surprise!!! It’s a model. It was dope to build. Got me into making models now.
customer_reviews.author: xMRxHIPPIEx

customer_reviews.title: Love this kit and am very happy with how it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this kit and am very happy with how it came out. There weren't any issues. It was pretty much paint, paint, & assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: Tamiya greatness
customer_reviews.text: Best model ever! The body went together with chassis seamlessly, a nice click to let you know it's in place! This Tamiya model made me get more Tamiya products. Currently working on USS Missouri.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Just what I expected from the Tamaiya Co.
customer_reviews.author: k skye

customer_reviews.title: Directions were easy enough to follow but some of my pieces didn’t ...
customer_reviews.text: Directions were easy enough to follow but some of my pieces didn’t fit properly, like the exhaust on the undercarriage and the splash plates didn’t want to stay on either
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Gtr34
customer_reviews.text: Great Model,if you have any others GTR's let me know or any other models,shipping was on time! Very happy! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Guillen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality fell apart and broke don’t buy. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: louise brennan

customer_reviews.title: Very good kit
customer_reviews.text: Fun and easy kit it make a good fast and furious skyline would recommend it to any fan of fast and furious and model kit builders
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected looks great finished perfect project to keep someone occupied for some time. Makes a perfect gift for anyone who likes building or models.
customer_reviews.author: Kinan Jagdesh Ramroop

customer_reviews.title: ... and back windows roof was crushed in so not happy with that
customer_reviews.text: it came open no plastic wraping on it only a rubber band and windows plastic were broke in two front and back windows roof was crushed in so not happy with that model
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very misleading picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture displays blue color , very disappointing that is not painted, should have read the fine lines in the description, very misleading picture, not a very solid material either
customer_reviews.author: Farzan

customer_reviews.title: Very bad
customer_reviews.text: The toy is very bad. The parts are too small and cannot stick it to each other. Its useless to buy it. Very difficult and not good product. I tried too many time but must use glue. Be careful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Tamiya Nissan Skyline GT-R R34 V-Spec II 1/24 Scale Model Kit 24258
product_meta.description:
Special edition features

the metallic chrome special Nissan Skyline comes with all the plastic parts molded in a chrome Blue metallic color.

The Nissan Skyline GT-R (R32), released in 1989, was developed as a base machine for group-a races. Taking full advantage of its powerful 2.6L, 6-cylinder, twin Turbo engine, It was equipped with a 4WD system. Originally designated as R32, the car was termed R33 in 1995 and R34 in 1999. In October 2000, the skyline underwent minor changes such as the addition of large rear brakes to upgrade performance further. This new evolution was called the v-spec II. The most drastic alteration was the replacement of the aluminum hood with a new carbon hood featuring a NACA duct. The carbon pattern of the hood would stand out even when painted the same color as the car body. Both inside and outside surfaces of the hood were designed using RTM, a new construction method yielding smooth surfaces. The v-spec II also features the previous improvements of the v-spec: front/rear diffusers and 18-inch tires, brake discs with Brembo calipers, and a 6-speed transmission. In February 2002, Nissan released a limited edition car called "nur", named after the Nurburgring circuit, and equipped with an N1 racing specification engine. Combining the impressive specifications of both the v-spec II and the M-Spec, 1000 units of the "nur" Were produced in all. Marketed as the last GT-R to equip a straight 6 engine, all 1000 were sold-out in one day, attesting to its incredible popularity. The new 2000 gas Regulation forced Nissan to end production of the GT-R in August 2002, however the glory of this ultimate sports car lives on.
